## [CF Q2 2025 Development Report](/blog/2025-06-30-quarterly-development-report)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

Below is a well-deserved Q2 update highlighting ecosystem tooling and solutions across April, May, and June.

The past three months have been all about tightening up infrastructure, enhancing developer tools, and shipping valuable updates to support the Cardano ecosystem.
With over 90 pull requests merged and 60+ issues closed in June alone, it‚Äôs been a highly productive quarter.

Check out the highlights below to see what‚Äôs been delivered.

## ‚öô Cardano Rosetta Java[‚Äã](#gear-cardano-rosetta-java "Direct link to gear-cardano-rosetta-java")

`cardano-foundation/cardano-rosetta-java`

`v1.2.9`

**June**: 18 PRs Merged | 5 Issues Closed

## üèõ Yaci Store[‚Äã](#classical_building-yaci-store "Direct link to classical_building-yaci-store")

`bloxbean/yaci-store`

`bloxbean/yaci-store`

**April**: v2.0.0-beta1 Released ‚Äî now with full ledger-state calculation! This is huge ü§Ø:heart\_on\_fire::*up\_parrot*:
No need for DB Sync ‚Äî Yaci Store independently derives rewards, ADAPot, and governance state from block data.

**May**: One of the most active repositories this month ‚Äî with 13 PRs merged tackling governance data integrity, rollback logic, and infrastructure improvements

Major upgrades:

**June**: 20 PRs Merged | 6 Issues Closed

Big month for Yaci Store ‚Äî including the 2.0.0-beta2 pre-release!

#### Thanks you to everyone who contributed throughout Q2. Your dedication, expertise, and energy are driving real progress across the ecosystem![‚Äã](#thanks-you-to-everyone-who-contributed-throughout-q2-your-dedication-expertise-and-energy-are-driving-real-progress-across-the-ecosystem "Direct link to Thanks you to everyone who contributed throughout Q2. Your dedication, expertise, and energy are driving real progress across the ecosystem!")

Monthly changelogs can be below:

## [Masumi Interview](/blog/2025-06-24-june)

![Denicio Bute](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

[![https://www.masumi.network/](/img/devblog/masumi-dark.png)![https://www.masumi.network/](/img/devblog/masumi-light.png)](https://www.masumi.network/)

![https://www.masumi.network/](/img/devblog/masumi-dark.png)
![https://www.masumi.network/](/img/devblog/masumi-light.png)

In this interview, Kristian Portz, co-founder of Masumi Network, explains how the platform builds infrastructure for AI agents to work together, make decisions, and handle payments autonomously - while staying secure and compliant with European regulations. Built on the Cardano blockchain, Masumi creates transparent systems where agents interact without human input. Portz highlights real-world use cases in finance and healthcare and considers how AI agents might shape future governance, marking a shift in technology collaboration. Sounds Exciting? Well..let‚Äôs dive right in!

## [Decentralizing Open-Source Development](/blog/2025-05-09-media-cardano-developer-office-hours)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

In this session of the Cardano Developer Office Hours, the team presents PoP (Proof of Provenance), a project to decentralize open-source development on Cardano. They cover risks of centralized infrastructure, using Cardano for verifiable software metadata, Merkle trees, and on-chain tracking. A live demo shows PoP in action. Use cases include secure versioning, on-chain test management, SPOs as decentralized oracles, and decentralized package tools.

[**Watch now**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rCSFiF4rMXI)

## [Scalus DApp Development Platform](/blog/2025-04-11-media-cardano-developer-office-hours)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

Alex Nemish and Oleksii Khodakivskyi from Lantr introduce Scalus, a smart contract framework built with Scala 3. They walk through the vision, roadmap, and show how it simplifies development on Cardano, including a live demo of a payment splitter contract. This session is ideal for devs exploring new tools to build on Cardano.

[**Watch now**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UJeFLy92D4Q)

## [P2P DeFi Interview](/blog/2025-03-31-march)

![Denicio Bute](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

In this interview, Rusty, also known as fallen-icarus on X, shares his vision for a truly decentralized financial system. He discusses the flaws in today‚Äôs DeFi models, which often rely on centralized mechanisms, and explains why a shift to P2P DeFi is necessary. Rusty breaks down key concepts like liquidity sharing, UTXO contention, and free-market solutions, offering a fresh perspective on making DeFi more scalable, efficient, and accessible. To learn more about the P2P DeFi solution Rusty proposes, check out the full interview below.

## [Cardano Ecosystem Engineering](/blog/2025-03-28-media-cardano-developer-office-hours)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

Giovanni Gargiulo, Senior Software Engineer at the Cardano Foundation, shares how ecosystem engineering supports Cardano‚Äôs growth. The session covers DevOps practices behind scalability, security, and uptime, along with challenges of running decentralized infrastructure. Giovanni also touches on infrastructure evolution, global adoption, and what‚Äôs ahead for Cardano engineering.

[**Watch now**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3w3y3cdaWQA)

## [Java Tooling for dApps Development](/blog/2025-03-24-media-cardano-developer-office-hours)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

Satya Ranjan, Lead Blockchain Architect at the Cardano Foundation, presents Java tools for building on Cardano. The session covers `cardano-client-lib`, writing off-chain code, building transactions, and integrating governance and staking. Satya also demos Yaci DevKit for local dev environments, Yaci Store for indexing, and shows how to build lightweight apps using tailored data. Ideal for developers and exchanges exploring Java‚Äôs role in Cardano infrastructure.

`cardano-client-lib`

[**Watch now**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L1_E9Bc-f_Y)

## [Presenting Reeve](/blog/2025-02-28-media-cardano-developer-office-hours)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

This installment of the Cardano Developer Office Hours explores Reeve, a next-generation accountability tool for delivering tamper-proof and transparent financial insights. Reeve integrates traditional accounting systems with blockchain technology, ensuring transparency, immutability, and security for financial records. Built on Cardano, the platform offers a decentralized approach to financial data management. Designed for accountants, auditors, non-profits, and enterprises, Reeve helps streamline audits, improve efficiency, and build trust in financial processes. The session provides an overview of the project, its architecture, and current development.

[**Watch now**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UqQsAej0CLE)

## [Inter-Blockchain Communication](/blog/2025-02-14-media-cardano-developer-office-hours)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

This installment of the Cardano Developer Office Hours explores the Cosmos-Cardano Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) bridge project. The session provides an overview of the architecture, current development, and key components driving the project. Topics include the IBC protocol, blockchain interoperability, and the integration of Cosmos SDK with Cardano. A live demo showcases how to send messages between the Cosmos network and a local Cardano node. The session also covers real-world use cases like token transfers, cross-chain swaps, and more.

[**Watch now**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZO17Tg0re40)

## [Java Implementation on Rosetta](/blog/2025-02-05-media-cardano-developer-office-hours)

![Cardano Foundation](/img/authors/cardano-foundation.png)

This 13th installment of the Cardano Developer Office Hours is presented by Thomas Kammerlocher, Senior Full Stack Developer at the Cardano Foundation. Thomas discusses the Java implementation of Rosetta, a tool developed by Coinbase for exchanges to integrate with Cardano. Rosetta simplifies multi-chain support with its blockchain-agnostic API, and the transition from TypeScript to Java enhances performance and reduces resource consumption. Upcoming updates include support for staking rewards tracking, off-chain data integration, and more improvements to scalability and efficiency.

[**Watch now**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rbiH6GYWbyQ)
